snippet: An appeals court ruled that the judge in Paul W. Bergrin’s case “usurped the jury’s role.”
abstract: United States Appeals Court for the Third Circuit removes Judge William J Martini from the case of prominent defense lawyer Paul W Bergrin, accused of of orchestrating the murder of a government informant; court argues that extraordinary remedy was necessary based on prosecutors' claims raising serious concerns about Bergrin's impartiality.
lead_paragraph: An appeals court ruled that the judge in Paul W. Bergrin’s case “usurped the jury’s role.”

headline.seo: Judge in Bergrin Murder Case Removed for Bias
headline.main: Judge Is Taken Off Murder Case for Bias Toward the Defendant
headline.print_headline: Judge Is Taken Off Murder Case for Bias Toward the Defendant
